metadata.title: CVE-2022-48863 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mISDN: Fix memory leak in dsp_pipeline_build()dsp_pipeline_build() allocates dup pointer by kstrdup(cfg),but then it updates dup variable by strsep(&dup, "|").As a result when it calls kfree(dup), the dup variable contains NULL.Found by Linux Driver Verification project (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-lowlatency - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-aws - 4.4.0-1136.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.142').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
